posts.postText:
From ComputerWorld - "In a major victory for the music industry, a New York federal judge has ordered embattled P2P software maker LimeWire to immediately and permanently stop distributing and supporting its file-sharing software."

Now here is what I have to say:
After years of giving pirates a place to share their loot, the battle that lasted all these years is lost to the RIAA with a junction passed down by the U.S. District Court.

To the record companies that think you have won, you are wrong. Pirates will never die, and your ship is already sinking. You took an important part of us on this day, but that is just it, a small part. Our network still stands and there are many more places for us. As long as we have those willing to fight and help each other for the good of free sharing, we will never fall. Keep on fighting.

Warez/Pirating is not allowed. 1d ban.
But you're Sanya so it's a 1 hour ban. :)
